Allò que es veu, Allò que s’amaga: What we see, what lies hidden
F-A-M és un webdoc. Un audiovisual que e: F-A-M is a web documentary. An interactive audiovisual resource requiring observation and participation. A narrative proposal focused on the collective imagination we hold of hunger.
No sabem quanta gent es mor al dia de fa: We do not know how many people die of starvation every day. Some estimate 25,000 deaths daily while others say 100,000. We have heard talk of starvation from the day we were born but do we understand it? Do we know who dies from starvation and why?
El temps de reproducció variarà en funci: The running time will vary according to your interaction with the documentary. From a few minutes to a few hours, you choose the depth of your experience.
F-A-M està pensat perquè juguis amb imat: FAM is designed for you to play with the images, to recognise them and discover them again. Turn on your camera and microphone to be part of this story because you actually already are.
Ara, comparteix la teva imatge. Dóna-li: Now, share your image. Click RECORD and describe what you have seen out loud. You have 10 seconds to do so and if you don't like your recording, you can do it again.
La fam és una dona africana famèlica, am: Hunger is a starving African women with many children. She doesn't go to school or have a job. She was born in a dry, corrupt, and sterile country. This infinitely repeated image stops us seeing the bigger picture.
Las causas del hambre están fijadas en n: The causes of hunger are static in our minds: droughts, wars and corrupt governments. It's almost always due to particular circumstances affecting them through. We almost never have anything to do with it.
Lliure Comerç i Dumping: el negoci perfe: Free trade and Dumping: the perfect business for European multinationals
La UE ha signat en els darrers anys acor: The EU has signed free-trade agreements with different regions of the world over recent years, amongst them, the African, Caribbean and Pacific Group of States (ACP). Whislt it urges countries from the Global South to open their borders to European products and investment, it subsidises European agriculture and industry exporting to those very regions, creating unfair competition between subsidised European products and those produced in the countries of the Global South. This practice of exporting at subsidised prices is known as dumping.
UE - Donald Tusk (President del Consell: EU - Donald Tusk (President of the European Council) and Jean Claude Junker (President of the European Commission)
Lliure Comerç i Dumping: el negoci perfe: Free trade and Dumping: the perfect business for European multinationals
República de Korea - Park Geun-hye (prim: Republic of Korea - Park Geun-hye (President of South Korea)
A Korea del Sud la indústria tecnològica: Technology has been one of the keys to South Korea's economic growth. Companies such as Samsung an LG are originally from Korea. The mobile phone industry relies on the extraction of minerals in countries such as the Democratic Republic of Congo. An activity that grows as demand for mobile phones around the world increases. Mining linked to the mobile phone industry has a direct impact on the quantity and quality of land available in the Global South for the production of food
El model de creixement econòmic arreu de: The model of economic growth present worldwide, but especially in industrialised countries, has been based on the consumption of energy from fossil fuels, which has been a key factor in explaining climate change. Recently the so-called developing countries have followed suit. Rather than treating starvation as a consequence of natural phenomena (meteorological phenomena such as droughts, floods, hurricanes and so on, which are increasing due to climate change), it's important to highlight the man-made origins of climate change in order to explain the causes of meteorological phenomena and their direct impact on the food security and sovereignty of countries.
Ajuda alimentària per ajudar les emprese: Food Aid help for Ameircan agro-indsutrial companies. USAid is the development agency of the United States
USAid és l'agència de cooperació nordame: It is one of the bodies which has done the most with food aid as a tool in the fight against starvation in emergency situations. Food aid normally uses surpluses in donor countries to flood countries in the Global South, whether they need it or not, with free food, adversely affecting local farmers and agriculture. It is one of the great contradictions of the international system in the fight against starvation. Sending agricultural surpluses, or specific products such as nutrient packs, completely subsidised by aid agencies, from the Global North to countries in the Global South damages the agricultural fabric of receiving countries, worsening further the state of food security in those countries.The US forecasts investing $1.35 bn in food aid to countries such as South Sudan, Iraq, Syria, Yemen and others in Central America and East Africa affected by phenomena such as El Niño. Funds which go directly to the American producers of rice, cereals and other foodstuffs.
La carrera pel control dels recursos la: China leading the race for control of resources
En els darrers anys la Xina ha augmentat: In recent years China has increased its presence in the countries of the Global South. As a partner (under the banner of "South-South" cooperation), as a lender, as an investor, and, above all, as an importer of natural resources. China's economic growth, alongisde the growing purchasing power of an expanding population, has been made possible partly due to access to natural resources (food, minerals, energy...) from mostly Africa and Latin America. Such domination of land, minerals and food which, although beneficial to economic elites in the Global South, limits the chances of the countries in the Global South moving towards Food Sovereignty.
Aràbia Saudí és un dels països que acumu: Saudi Arabia is one of the countries that has bought up the most land in Africa. Although Saudi Arabia hardly has problems of land shortage, it does have a shortage of water, which Saudi investors find, for example, on Ethiopian soil. Land and water which, therefore, are denied to rural populations in countries such as Ethiopia. Saudi Arabia, which purchases millions of hectares abroad (mainly in countries such as Ethiopia, Senegal and Mali) to produce food (rice, cereals etc.) to export back to the country, is just the tip of the iceberg when it comes to the millions of hectares all over the world that are in the hands of transnational compnaies, public and private investors, and development agencies.
Els representants dels països africans a: The representatives of African countries have been guests at the G8 and G20 summits for years now to discuss matters of interest to them, such as the fight against starvation. At these summits promises are made to aid development and development plans are drawn up, such as the ambitious NEPAD (New Partnership for Africa's Development), which was supposed to mean billions of investment and aid for African countries but has ended up being a disapointment. Once more, promises have been broken. African leaders, mute witnesses to the international summits where development and starvation are discussed, are usually relegated to the fringes of debate, with no chance (or will) to speak out in front of world powers.
La City de Londres és un dels principals: The city of London is one of the biggest financial centres in the world. The price of food is determined on the stock exchanges. the most important of which, globally, is Chicago's, whilst in Europe food is traded in the futures markets of London, Paris, Amsterdam, and Frankfurt. But currently, the majority of the buying and selling of these goods doesn't relate to real transactions. It is estimated that 75% of financial investment in the agricultural sector is speculative. The same banks, high risk funds,and insurance companies which caused the global financial crisis are the ones who speculate on food, taking advantage of the enormously deregulated and highly profitable global markets.
El que amaga l'ajuda: condicions i inver: Hidden by aid: conditions and financial investments
L'ajuda al desenvolupament es presenta h: Development aid is regularly portrayed as an essentially positive tool, but it often hides measures which have serious knock-on effects on the population of the Global South. For a long time development aid, in Spain as well, has been determined by the geopolotical and economic interests of donor countries. On of the current vehicles of financial cooperation is the FONPRODE (Fund for the Promotion of Development). One of its main aims is to assign Spanish cooperation fundss to investments in countries of the Global South through public and private investment funds. Some of these have their headquarters in tax havens and some investments made with Spanish funds have gone to projects that worsen issues such as land-grabbing or the use of land for export products instead of products which guarantee food sovereignty in the Global South.
El Banc Mundial, juntament amb l’FMI és: The World Bank, alongisde the IMF, is responsible for the implementation of structural adjustment programmes in the Global South. What's more, the World Bank, through advice and credit, has been one of the main actors in the process of shaping the productive and agricultural model of countries in the Global South. It advocates the "modernzation" and "industrialzation" of agriculture, the extraction of resources (especially energy and minerals) and the building of large infrastructure projects, for the benefit of the global economy, in other words, consumption in the Global North, the interests of big capital and the plans of multinational companies. The World Bank has used its credit to create patchwork agriculture in the countries of the Global South, "recommending" specialization and monoculture, seriusly damaging crop diversity and consequently food security and sovreignty; it has overseen the processs of internationalizing the agricultural sector in numerous countries, preferring to have the best land, in the hands of large companies, producing for foreign markets and not to meet local food needs; it has financed the construction of the infrastructure needed by the petrol, gas and mining industries, with direct enviromental impacts; and a long list of programmes which have resulted in growing debt and decreasing food sovereignty.
Ban Ki Moon - Secretari General de Nacio: Ban Ki Moon - Secretary General of the United Nations
Nacions Unides, juntament amb el Banc Mu: The United Nations, alongside the World Bank, is convinced that Africa can become the world's breadbasket and feed the rest of the planet. That's how its various bodies are planning their programmes. But before that can happen a series of internal changes need to be made. Thier experts argue that to reach this goal the circle of subsistence agriculture (which directly feeds families and isn't for large scale selling) has to be broken, investment in infrastructure that supports growth in the sector (motorways, bridges dams and so on) has to be made. Doing so would create economies of scale.
De deutes i austeritat que provoquen fam: On debts and austerity causing starvation
El Fons Monetari Internacional (FMI) és: The International Monetary Fund is responsible for the implementation of structural adjustment programmes all over the world. Since the outbreak of the debt crisis in Latin America, Africa and Asia in the 80s, the IMF's answer to situations of debt overhang has been austerity. An answer applied to countries asking the IMF for credit or needing debt restructuring, An answer that includes measures such as cuts to social rights, privitization, deregulation of the labour, trade and financial markets,elimination of subsidies and restructuring of production in the countries of the Global South towards the needs of the global market. These policies have had a direct impact on the food security and sovereignty of the Global South and are one of the main reasons behind states' inability to deal with shortages and famines.
Els acords en el si de l'OMC, tot i que: WTO agreements have ushered in the commercialization of areas such as food and natural resources, but not to the extent the countries of the North would have wished. The countries of the Global South have resisted and blocked various rounds of trade liberalization with the clear demand for protection of certain sectors, such as food. Countries such as the United States or the European Union have been able to acheive with bilateral agreements what they have failed to do within the framework of the WTO.
Demanar diners, enviar ajuda, demanar di: Asking for money, sending aid, asking for money, sending aid... A never ending cycle which we whose flaws we never manage to understand. NGOs and the general public in a closed circuit, where things improve only to get worse again. Politics.
Este webdoc forma parte del proyecto tra: This webdoc is part of the transmedia project ProjecteFAM
Una idea original de Sonia Ros Muriel: Original idea by Sonia Ros Muriel
Paremos. Y ¿si hay otras causas más prof: Paremos. Y ¿si hay otras causas más profundas, más determinantes, más incómodas, más indignantes?
Será muy difícil encontrar una solución: Será muy difícil encontrar una solución humanitaria a un problema político.
La deuda y la intervención de las grande: La deuda y la intervención de las grandes economías son una herramienta de dominación del presente. Descolonizar el hambre.
Una tierra comprada, un alimento que se: Una tierra comprada, un alimento que se va.
El precio (no pagado) de los recursos na: El precio (no pagado) de los recursos naturales son personas empujadas a la nada. Expolio.
Cambian las caras, continúan las polític: Cambian las caras, continúan las políticas.
